884795260:
[

Senior Digital Designer

Company Name Origin Energy Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 53 minutes ago Number of views 2 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Unique opportunity to lead design across a major portfolio of work!
  • Be part of our fantastic digital team in an agile environment
  • Central CBD location and competitive salary package
  • Permanent, Melbourne
  • Application close date: 5 October 2018


Origin – Australia’s Leading Integrated Energy Company

An integral part of Australia’s energy future, we explore, produce, generate and sell energy to power millions of Australian homes and businesses every day, keeping them going and growing.

Origin is the largest energy retailer in Australia, and with 4.3 million customers we’re constantly evolving and changing to better suit their needs. Our activities include power generation, energy trading, the sale of LPG, electricity, natural gas and solar as well as the development of new and emerging technologies. Consider your possibilities with Australia’s leading integrated energy company.

The Role

This is a unique opportunity to lead design across a major portfolio of work.

You will have responsibility for the final look and feel of the digital product, ensuring outstanding visual and interactive experiences. We want someone who can create beautiful, fluid and signature moments that delight our customers!

You'll be responsible for increasing the Experience Design team's digital design capability and developing effective stakeholder relationships with Tribe Leads, Experience Design Directors and other peer stakeholders. You'll also be working closely with Product Owners and UX designers, and applying design thinking to problem solving.

What Your Day To Day Will Look Like
  • Lead the digital design across a major portfolio of work
  • Direct, lead and conduct Digital Design Strategy activities such as facilitating emotional journey mapping and developing strategic design recommendations
  • Drive and build out the Origin Digital Design Language and component library
  • Help implement repeatable approaches (design patterns, templates, guides) across the digital design practice to minimize cost/complexity
  • Mentor and provide guidance to mid-weight and junior Digital Designers
  • Maintain Origin brand style guide, including AEM component suite
  • Ensure digital design consistency across website & app channels
  • Represent the digital design disciple in workshops and stand-ups
  • Deliver to required deadlines and manage stakeholder expectations when deadlines cannot be met
  • Work alongside front-end developers to implement your designs to a high standard
  • Effectively communicate brand identity and related design specifications, including: UI guidelines, screen layouts, colour palettes, typography & user interface elements
  • Rapidly iterate, creating multiple design solutions

Is This You?

You will have a strong command of digital design capabilities, including composition, layout information hierarchy, motion, typography, colour and animation.

You'll work collaboratively with cross-functional teams as an active contributor and for each initiative, have a clear understanding of the problem statements, user scenarios, information architecture, task-flow models/journeys, user research insights and wireframes/prototypes.

More About You
  • Extensive experience in a dedicated design role together with proven experience leading/mentoring junior & mid-weight designers
  • Demonstrate excellent design principles
  • Exceptional portfolio inclusive of domestic and international brands showcasing innovative design.
  • Strong Knowledge of HTML & CSS
  • Strong Knowledge Adobe creative cloud product suite and wireframe/prototype tools.
  • Ability to work in a lean and agile environment with a multi-disciplinary team
  • Responsive, Mobile and app experience
  • Strong stakeholder and communications skills and ability to present design work to multiple areas of the business
  • Ability to work across multiple projects simultaneously


We embrace the diversity of our people and flexible working arrangements to ensure our workforce is representative of the communities that we serve.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

MAKE AN IMPACT ON AUSTRALIA'S ENERGY FUTURE

If dynamic and challenging career opportunities and workplace flexibility are important to you, go with the employer that thinks differently.

Our story | Origin Energy

Requisition ID: 68024

Function: Marketing

Industry

  • Oil & Energy

The Company

The Role

In this crucial role, you will be part of a high performing corporate team that continues to lead the market and develop new client opportunities, with a focus on the multi-faceted Corporate portfolio to offer a range of hardware, document management and workflow solutions. Your responsibilities will include:

  • Identify and develop new customers to maintain sales growth
  • Build trusted and long-lasting relationships
  • Implement strategies to drive business growth and increase revenue

The Person

Job description

PACCAR Australia employs over 1,100 employees and was recently awarded the Employer of the Year category of the prestigious Victorian Training Awards for 2018 showcasing our commitment to attract highly talented people and also provide our staff with the necessary tools, training and development to excel to strive for quality in the products and services we provide.

\xa0

An exciting full time opportunity has become available at PACCAR Parts, a division of PACCAR Australia for a Managed Dealer Inventory (MDI) Demand Analyst. PACCAR Parts is a wholesale truck parts distributor. As well as supporting Kenworth and DAF brands, PACCAR Parts also distributes a comprehensive range of all makes truck and trailer parts and accessories via an extensive dealer network across Australia, New Zealand and Papua New Guinea.

\xa0

Reporting to the MDI Program Manager, the MDI Demand Analyst plays a key role in liaising with dealerships on a regular basis to maintain and improve dealer inventory performance and service levels through good inventory management, retail forecasting and support activities. The role is also responsible for evaluating, executing and optimizing inventory plans for assigned parts dealerships to ensure high stock availability of parts.

\xa0\xa0\xa0

To be successful in this role you will have exceptional interpersonal and communication skills coupled with an analytical mind and understand the importance of accuracy and attention to detail.

\xa0

Recent graduates from a Business (with an analytical major e.g. statistics, forecasting, accounting) or Logistics qualifications are encouraged to apply.

\xa0

Additionally, the successful candidate will also have excellent PC skills, being able to master MS Access & Excel, and some exposure to Dealer Business System, AS400 and SQL Server will be highly regarded.

\xa0

In return PACCAR Australia offers a competitive salary in conjunction with ongoing investment in its employees through training and development with opportunities for tuition reimbursement, corporate health plan, subsidised cafe and free onsite parking.

New Posted Date Posted 52 minutes ago Number of views 8 views

Job description

Program Manager - UO Applications
Job no: 570769
Work type: Full time - Continuing/Permanent
Categories: Information Technology
  • Full time, Permanent Position
  • $111,645-$119,623 +17% Super
  • Convenient CBD location

Our Organisation

RMIT is a global university of technology, design and enterprise. Our mission is to help shape the world through research, innovation, teaching and engagement, and to create transformative experiences for our students, getting them ready for life and work.

Information Technology Services (ITS) provides RMIT University with Information and Communication Technology systems and services. Our role is to support RMIT’s high quality teaching, learning, research and administrative activities. Information Technology is of increasing importance to the research, teaching and learning life of a university, particularly a ‘global university of technology and design’ like RMIT. ITS has developed, in conjunction with the broader University, an ICT Plan to 2020.

The Role & Your Responsibilities

The Program Manager is accountable for the delivery of all projects within the Business Applications program of work; within the University Operations portfolio including vendor/partner run projects/programs. The Program Manager supports the Senior Portfolio Manager in establishing and delivering to a roadmap of initiatives that drive benefit for the University.

The Program Manager will plan, schedule, monitor and report on activities related to the program to ensure that each project and program contributes to the overall success of the portfolio. The Program Manager will identify risks and manage issues with appropriateness of work for this program; identify interdependencies, impact on business activity, deviation from strategic aims, erosion of expected benefit, program staffing and costs.

Skills & Experience Required
  • Extensive experience in a senior project/program manager position
  • Exceptional interpersonal, communication and negotiation skills, with the ability to liaise effectively with internal and external clients. Excellent attention to detail in written and spoken communications in order to identify and solve issues.
  • Demonstrated experience in successfully leading Applications and Infrastructure projects and/or programs using Waterfall/Agile methodologies, managing large, complex projects with multi-function teams
  • Demonstrated experience and ability to manage staff who are not co-located
  • Evidence of budget accountability and responsibility of $5M+ portfolios
  • Strong self-confidence and decisive ability to work independently, managing a functional area to achieve targets on time and within a budget
  • Strong vendor / partner management capability including SaaS (software as a service)/ Cloud Vendors.

To Apply

To view a position description, please visit http://yourcareer.rmit.edu.au and search using job #570769

Program Manager PD.pdf

Applications close on Sunday 7th October 2018

RMIT is an equal opportunity employer committed to being a child safe organisation. We are dedicated to attracting, retaining and developing our people regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability and age. Applications are encouraged from all sectors of the community.

Donor Relations Manager

Company Name University of Melbourne Company Location Parkville , Melbourne, VIC 3010, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 28 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

University of Melbourne Advancement


  • Join Australia’s number 1 university as part of a globally recognised advancement team
  • Sustain meaningful engagement with the university’s most significant donors
  • Develop personal, bespoke opportunities that strengthen donor relationships


Salary: $99,199 - $107,370 per annum (pro-rata if applicable) plus 17% superannuation


The Organisation

Established in 1853, the University of Melbourne is a public-spirited institution that makes distinctive contributions to society in research, learning and teaching\xa0and engagement. It is consistently ranked among the leading universities in the world, with international rankings of world universities placing it as number 1 in Australia and number 32 in the world.


The Role

The Donor Relations Manager is a senior position in the Donor Relations team. It plays a significant role in the advancement team, responsible for developing and executing donor engagement plans with the University’s most significant donors giving at transformational levels.


This is a highly collaborative position that will require you to interpret data and develop personal and bespoke engagement strategies with donors that deepen their connection to the work of the University. You will also monitor the implementation of gifts and further engage donors on their journey.


Skills required

You will be an intelligent and sophisticated communicator. Your background could be; corporate hospitality, membership, wealth management, executive support or other positions that have exposed you to working on a personal and professional level with high net worth individuals.


You will be pro –active and client focused with the ability to generate ideas and solve problems. You will have experience working in an organisation that requires you to work collaboratively and think strategically when exercising judgement and making decisions.


The University employs people of outstanding calibre and offers a unique environment where staff are valued and rewarded. Benefits include flexibility, an excellent remuneration package (17% superannuation) and professional development.


How to apply

Join a globally recognised advancement team in Australia’s leading University. Please do not apply via the University website. We are recruiting in partnership with NGO Recruitment. To apply, please forward your cover letter and resume in MS Word format to cv@ngorecruitment.com quoting reference #34475 or contact Emma Adams on (03) 8319 4090.


Close date: 30 Sep 2018

\xa0
For full position information and to apply online go to:
http://jobs.unimelb.edu.au/caw/en/job/894508/donor-relations-manager

Company Name Guild Group Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 92 views

Job description

About Us


Guild Insurance is Australia’s leading provider of insurance solutions for allied healthcare professionals. For more than 50 years, we’ve been providing exceptional products and services and unparalleled customer experiences, driven by a genuine care for our clients’ professional and financial wellbeing. Our comprehensive product suite includes professional indemnity, public liability, workers compensation as well as business, home & contents and car insurance. We are Australian-owned with offices nationally, so our customers benefit from our local knowledge and presence.

The Role


Guild Insurance currently has an opportunity for a Business Development Manager based in Melbourne to deliver the Guild Insurance strategy. This full term permanent opportunity will be responsible for growing client numbers and premium income through the sale of Guild products, whilst leading and coaching the Guild Insurance sales culture across Distribution. Some key accountabilities will include:


  • Leading the sales / acquisition plan for region working closely with National Sales Team
  • Building and maintaining relationships with existing and new partners; and major clients
  • Prospecting larger accounts for new business
  • Assisting Account Managers with new business where required
  • Product/Sales Training of new staff & existing as needed
  • Attending Trade shows/Conferences
  • Working across Guild businesses to cross promote each other
  • Leading managing and developing key relationships with clients
  • Leading and coaching employees across Distribution to drive a sales culture and achieve overall profit, growth and retention targets
  • Acting as a key product SME across the Insurance business
  • Working closely with internal stakeholders to own and construct strategic campaigns to fully develop the capability of each client relationship
  • Design, develop, deliver and monitor annual key client management plans
  • Representing and providing presentations on behalf of Guild Insurance at various professional trade shows, functions and events as required

About You


The successful candidate will have the following skills and experience:


  • Previous experience in a similar business development and sales management role within the insurance industry
  • Demonstrated ability to consistently achieve sales targets
  • Good knowledge of underwriting guidelines within the commercial insurance industry
  • Effective selling, networking and negotiation skills
  • Tier 1 Insurance Qualifications
  • Cert IV - General Insurance
  • You will have a keen eye for detail, be highly analytical and results focused
  • You will be confident and approachable and be able to demonstrate exceptional business development and relationship management skills
  • You will enjoy liaising with a variety of people internally and externally

Why join us?

At Guild Insurance we’re proud to say it’s a place you can make things happen. Because of our size, we are more nimble to change; we can offer broader and more interesting roles, more exposure to the wider business and more opportunities for career advancement. We are a values driven organisation with a genuine, friendly and collaborative culture that respects, rewards and values input and innovation from all levels of the business. Guild Insurance is an organisation on an exciting journey. If you’re passionate, driven and focused about what you do, and you want the freedom to make a difference, you’ll love being part of our team.
Have you got what it takes to deliver?

Next Steps
If this sounds like the right opportunity for you then please submit your details applying online.

Prime Motive is looking for a Junior to Mid Front End Developer to join our growing team. The successful candidate will be passionate and motivated to learn. Scientific Mechanical, Electronic & Microelectronic Engineers

Company Name Defence Science and Technology Group Company Location Fishermans Bend, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 9 hours ago Number of views 22 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Multiple Scientific Engineering positions at Defence Science & Technology

Are you an electronic, mechanical or micro engineer?

  • Apply your engineering skills to scientific innovation and research
  • Contribute to world-class research covering the spectrum of defence capability
  • Be a part of one of Australia’s largest employers of scientists and engineers


Position Classification: S&T 3 through to S&T 4 level positions

Salary Range: $66,436 - $91,238 plus 15.4% superannuation

Position Locations: Edinburgh, South Australia, or, Fisherman’s Bend, Victoria

Security Clearance: NV2

Enquiries: Ben Barona, ben.barona@dst.defence.gov.au (08) 7389 6087


Defence Science and Technology (DST) is the Australian Government’s lead agency responsible for applying science and technology to safeguard Australia. Our vision is to be a world leader in defence science and technology, indispensable in transforming the Australian Defence Force and Australia’s national security.


DST’s Scientific Engineering Services (SES) deliver specialised scientific engineering, design and fabrication solutions contributing to keeping DST at the forefront of Australian Defence innovation, and providing valuable support to Defence and National Security operations. SES provides integrated, multidisciplined, leading edge, rapid response and innovative scientific engineering solutions to DST, across the breadth of Defence technologies. SES fosters a culture of excellence, world leading capability and strong external partnerships dedicated to supporting the engineering needs of DST. SES will strongly consider part time applicants and strongly encourages both male and female engineers to apply. SES will provide and fund opportunities for further training, education and professional development to enhance skills in the domain of electronic systems design and development.


SES are seeking skilled and enthusiastic engineers looking to develop a career in: Electronic Engineering, Microelectronic Packaging and Mechanical Engineering. All positions collaborate across the spectrum of mechanical, electronic, micro engineering and applied imaging design engineers for product development; and with subcontractors for design and delivery of prototypes and tooling including discrete components. They also collaborate and partner with DST researchers to design and manufacture to unique and innovative requirements.


At DST you will have the privilege of working with some of Australia’s most talented and world leading scientists and engineers. Our staff enjoy the benefits of Australian Public Service conditions with competitive salary/non-salary packages including lucrative superannuation, as well as flexible, family-friendly working arrangements. We are committed to helping employees balance work and home life with a range of effective policies, practices and social networks. \xa0\xa0

We also provide on-the-job training, access to advanced scientific computing learning opportunities, development prospects to grow your scientific computing skill and experience, as well as mentoring to develop your emerging leadership skills and further expand your capability.


For more information and to apply, please follow this link to the position descriptions on the DST website: DST Group Multiple Scientific Engineering Positions - Position Description DST/01482/18

Melbourne Convention and Exhibition Centre (MCEC) is Melbourne’s destination for big ideas and inspirational events. Hosting more than 1000 events each year, we’re internationally renowned for our incredible range of spaces, innovative design and jaw-dropping food.


We have an opportunity for a suitably skilled Audio Visual\xa0Systems Engineer to join our Technology Infrastructure and Equipment team. As our Audio Visual\xa0Systems Engineer your primary responsibility will be ensuring all of our event-based technology equipment and infrastructure is functioning, fit for purpose and delivers to our customers' expectations.


The role

In this role, you will be empowered to...

  • Diagnose and repair equipment faults on wide variety of AV equipment
  • Communicate equipment availability using our 'Out of Service' procedures
  • Triage any off-site and on-site repairs
  • Recommend and implement life-cycle equipment replacement programs


You will be working closely with our Technology Services crew to ensure you are across equipment requirements, our ICT team when needed as well as liaising with external suppliers when required. You will also be supporting our team with coaching and training on new equipment and providing advice on solutions to support the team.


Your role has a focus on continuous improvement in ensuring you are proactively recommending opportunities to improve MCEC's systems and services when it comes to delivering world-class event technology. You

886457924:
[

Associate

Company Name Gray Puksand Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 3 hours ago Number of views 6 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Gray Puksand:

\xa0
Gray Puksand is an Australian architecture and integrated design practice with studios in Brisbane, Melbourne and Sydney.

Our vision is to create an inspired future with beautiful, authentic and considered projects that improve the way people work, learn and live.

The human experience is at the heart of everything we create. Working across multiple sectors, from education and commercial architecture to workplace and retail design, our design process begins with investigating and truly understanding our clients’ desires and aspirations. We employ our extensive knowledge, research and excellence in design to create future-proof environments.

Individually, we are accomplished, curious, imaginative designers. Collectively, we are a diverse national team, applying a consistent design methodology to deliver successful projects for our clients and the people who inhabit them.
\xa0
About the Role:
\xa0
We are looking for an experienced Architect with a passion for Education and Commercial Architecture and Design to become an emerging leader within our National Practice.
\xa0
With a strong plan to become a Top 10, Tier 1 Practice by 2020 we are looking for more emerging leaders to become part of our growing Practice as we continue to go from strength to strength.
\xa0
As an Associate your role will be to act as a leader and representative of the company on large Education and Commercial projects ranging from 20 to 100+ million dollars.

\xa0

You will continue to play a project leader overseeing the delivery of multiple projects of varying sizes across several team of highly engaged, passionate and competent designers. As a leader you will also play a mentoring role to staff members both within projects and as part of our mentoring and development programs.

You will become part of a growing team of over 100 Design and Architectural professionals across Australia and join a growing team of nearly 70 highly engaged, passionate and competent professionals in our Melbourne Studio.
\xa0
This is a perfect role for someone who is currently in a similar position or acting as a Senior Project Architect/Project Leader looking to step up to the next level. There is no better time to join our leading National Practice, as we continue to experience sustained growth towards our 2020 goals.
\xa0
This role is based at our Head Studio in the heart of the Melbourne CBD. Our offices are at the cutting edge of ‘work-space design’ so you will be surrounded by an inspiring environment every day.

Getting to work is a breeze as we are located within 5 minutes’ walk from Southern Cross Station and Bourke and Collins street trams. In addition, we have secure onsite bike parking and outstanding change facilities with lockers and free towel service! With on-site yoga, a weekly running group and Corporate Triathlon events, you can find the work-life balance you have been looking for. We believe that a balanced life lead to better outcomes for all.

General Duties:\xa0

  • Oversee projects for end to end: client briefings, workshops, concept design, space planning, design development, documentation to on-site construction management and contract administration
  • Oversee the management of project operations; including resourcing, invoicing and project review using Deltek Vision software
  • Oversee the cohesive working relationships and outcomes of your project teams
  • Contribute to the ongoing development and mentoring of other staff members
  • Manage and lavage existing client relationships
  • Build and maintain strong relationships with consultants, builders and other relevant industry contacts
  • Be seen as a respected design professional in the industry and remain at the forefront of design thinking in Education and/or Commercial/Mixed Use markets


About you:

Ideally you have a respected reputation and experience across Education and/or Commercial/Mixed Use sectors including but not limited to; TAFE’s, Universities, Schools, ELC, Commercial/Mixed Use Multistorey Developments and Refurbishments. \xa0

\xa0
Our leaders lead by example and are able to put their hand to day to day tasks when required so you will need to be passionate about design and able to manage projects from end to end as a project leader with; strong design, design development and construction skills and knowledge of relevant BCA’s and related building regulations and specifications.
\xa0
We create designs that are inspiring, functional and future proof so the ability to design to \xa0clients and user groups needs is paramount.


To be successful in this role you will need:

    • Established reputation in Education or Commercial Architecture
    • Minimum of 10 years’ experience in education, commercial/mixed use practice or environment, preferably as a qualified or registered architect
    • Excellent communication skills and ability to proactively communicate and manage clients, consultants and internal team members to achieve desired outcomes
    • Experience and involvement in client relationship management
    • Demonstrated experience in developing and delivering designs from briefing to project handover
    • Solution focus – demonstrated proactive and collaborative approach to projects, clients and teams
    • Proven ability to manage and oversee multiple projects at once


What is on Offer?


For the right person, this role presents the opportunity to take a step up in your career and work on complex and interesting projects across a variety of industries including, but not limited to; commercial (green and brown-fields), mixed use, education, retail and retirement lifestyle and care.
\xa0
In addition to this, Gray Puksand can offer:

  • Structured Professional Development
  • Internal Training and Emerging Leaders Program
  • Passionate, highly engaged, respectful, fun-loving team
  • An empowering and encouraging leadership team
  • Established Pathway to Partnership Program
  • A growing national firm who will support your career as it goes from strength to strength
  • High calibre projects which will require innovative and ‘out of the box’ thinking


Furthermore, you will be rewarded with a competitive remuneration package and ongoing career development.
\xa0
To Apply:
\xa0
Please press the ‘Apply’ button. Please attach your folio as the cover letter (ensure these are compressed to 2MB to comply with the file uploads).
\xa0
Find Out More:
\xa0
To find out more about our projects and practice please go to www.graypuksand.com.au

\xa0

Community and Cultural Development Officer

Company Name cohealth Company Location Footscray, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 6 hours ago Number of views 13 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

0.6 EFT, 3 days per week


fixed Term until June 30th 2021


Based in Footscray


Not for Profit "Salary Sacrificing" benefits on top of your salary


Do you have experience in Community Arts and Cultural Development?


Do you have a welcoming disposition and the ability to form positive relationships that foster growth and development?

If this describes you, please keep reading


About the role


Within this role, you will focus on current and upcoming arts based community projects working with culturally diverse communities and external partners. The primary projects of focus will be the Benchmark and Stir it Up initiatives occurring across the western metropolitan region of Melbourne. Along with supporting the planning and evaluation of these projects you will also provide support for other cohealth Arts Generator projects and programs.


cohealth Arts Generator\xa0is part of the Prevention and Population Health Planning stream which aims to improve health, wellbeing and social inclusion through cross-organisational programs, external partnerships and community development. This prevention program looks to create meaningful engagement opportunities for communities who identify as people of colour. Through art and creative expression this program supports people who have experienced structural disadvantage explore their sense of self, increase wellbeing and agency, develop life skills, and create connections within and between communities to strengthen social cohesion. The programs focus on a variety of artistic expression.


You will value interacting with other professionals and thrive on working in a supportive culture founded on teamwork, integrity and social justice. To be suitable for this position, your qualifications and skills for the role will consist of:


  • Tertiary qualification or significant work experience in community and cultural development;
  • An understanding and commitment to the principles of community health, health promotion and community development;
  • Program delivery skills inclusive of, community consultation, planning, implementation, evaluation and leadership;
  • well-developed interpersonal and communication skills, the ability to deal with people from all facets of the community and good organisational skills; and
  • A curious and positive approach to your work life, continuously striving to contribute to the growth and development of cohealth as a provider of choice.

In addition to these characteristics lived experience either identifying as a person of colour and/or as Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander would be seen as an advantage.


If you are a hard-working, reliable individual who enjoys interacting with the community and genuinely making a difference, please apply.


Who is cohealth?


For more information about cohealth and the services provided, please visit our website: www.cohealth.org.au


This position will be paid under the Community Health Centre (Stand Alone Services) Social and Community Service Employees Multi Enterprise Agreement 2013 - 2015, Community Development Worker Class 2B Year 2 (SCHADS Level 4)

To be considered for the role, you are required to provide a CV or work portfolio demonstrating your skills and experience relevant to the position description, along with a cover letter that responds to these questions:


  • Why are you applying for this job? (Suggested word limit: 200 words)
  • What skills and experience do you bring to this role? (Suggested word limit: 300 words)
  • What is your understanding of the relationship between community arts and cultural development and positive community health outcomes? (200 words)


People interested in applying may do so directly through the cohealth website https://cohealthcareers.org.au/Jobs/ Alternately, an optional position information session will be held on October 10th between 3.00 and 5.00pm at the Arts Generator office at the Footscray Community Arts Centre, 45 Moreland St Footscray. Applicants may discuss or submit their applications in person on this day. Applicants interested in attending this session should register by emailing the Prevention Manager, Jeremy Hearne at Jeremy.hearne@cohealth.org.au


This role is a leadership position within the Prevention Team and the successful applicant will need to be able to demonstrate the relevant experience and skills required for the role


Applications close on Sunday 14th October @ 10.00pm.


People accepting employment with cohealth are unable to access our services, some exemptions may apply.


People of culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds and people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent, ; including women, people with disabilities, people who identify as LGBTIQ; are encouraged to apply.


The suitable applicant will be subject to the relevant pre-employment checks for appointment to positions (including provision of a valid Working with Children Check clearance number and criminal record history check)


To apply for this job go to: www.cohealthcareers.org.au/Jobs/ & enter ref code: 4370876. Internal Reference P0547

Job description

Cannon Hill location

Flexible working hours available

Work for an amazing company who makes a difference!

Endeavour Foundation is a fast growing for-purpose national organisation with over 5,000 staff plus volunteers, providing support and services to people with a disability in over 300 locations nationally. The National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS) is being implemented and is a landmark time of transformation within our sector, providing an opportunity for you to be at the forefront of one of the biggest organisational change and people transformation journeys in Australia.

About The Role

PeopleSoft is the Human Resource Information System at Endeavour Foundation. To support business growth there is a need to optimise the HRIS to expand functionality and optimise new technologies. The HRIS Business Analyst will utilise their PeopleSoft experience to lead the design and implementation of HRIS Optimisation initiatives from a functional HR perspective:
  • Manage each optimisation project end to end, including the creation of business requirements and functional specification documents, coordinate timing, oversee testing and implementation, create user training documents, update work instructions, and take users through the change.
  • Monitor solutions once implemented, and measure effectiveness of system and processes.
  • Ongoing analysis of as is business processes, identifying inefficiencies, risks, and opportunities for Endeavour to further optimise system design and HR process.
  • Collaborate with internal and external technical resources to coordinate People Experience system change activities that deliver the best outcomes for our customers
  • Contribute subject matter expertise on selection of Talent, Learning and Recruitment solutions that will enhance the People Experience.

This role offers a lot of flexibility, and the opportunity to manage your own part-time hours. The contract end date will align with the delivery of immediate project outcomes and permanent employment may be available depending on ongoing business needs.

About You
  • Bachelors Degree in Business / Commerce / Information Technology
  • Experience as a Functional PeopleSoft Analyst / Consultant
  • Experience integrating between PeopleSoft and other systems would be beneficial
  • Demonstrated success in managing small projects using a Project management methodology, including process mapping, design, testing, and implementation
  • Advanced Excel, Word and PowerPoint
  • Superior communication and relationship management skills, with the ability to translate business needs into technical system requirements and vice versa
  • SQL Programming skills and experience building queries advantageous

Before commencing with Endeavour Foundation you will be required to undertake a National Criminal History check and hold or be willing to obtain a positive notice from Disability Services (Yellow Card) and Working with Children Check (Blue card).

883826062:
[

IT Governance & Assurance Manager

Company Name City West Water Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 154 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Play an influential role in leading the Governance and Assurance function
  • Collaborative, diverse, high-energy team environment
  • Access to flexible working arrangements


The organisation

Based in Melbourne’s CBD fringe, City West Water provides world-class clean drinking water and sewerage services to over one million customers and 40,000 businesses in Melbourne’s CBD and the growing western suburbs. We are proud to serve the city that has been awarded world’s most liveable time and time again, and are working hard to support our customers through the challenges of population growth and a changing climate.

We are creating an organisation that is as vibrant and diverse as the community we serve, as we recognise that our people are our greatest asset.

The opportunity

City West Water is always adopting new ways of working and embracing new technologies to meet its rapidly changing customer environment. The opportunity to play an influential role in this dynamic environment is now available within the IT Governance Manager.

Reporting to the Chief Information Officer, we are seeking an energetic and driven individual to establish and lead the Governance and Assurance function. This role will be collaborating with business and technology stakeholders to adopt or develop assurance frameworks, fit for purpose methodologies and develop and monitor service and delivery practices. This work ensures the ability of IT to successfully build upon customer engagement, and execute projects and operational activities within the timeframes set. This role is responsible for ensuring that IT meets its compliance obligations within the organisation and to external regulators, and ensures that IT is operating at optimal efficiency, delivering on customer outcomes.

The position is responsible for ensuring that the strategic principle ‘we live and breathe safety and wellbeing’ is put into practice, contributing to the successful implementation of the corporate strategy for City West Water.

The Position Is Critical To
  • Establish a clear vision and framework for technological Governance to ensure service delivery operates in a flexible but outcome driven manner
  • Working collaboratively within IT and with business stakeholders to ensure consistency in methodology and program delivery
  • Monitors projects deliver upon set objectives/outcomes within budget and timeframes
  • Apply effective communication strategies in order to ensure governance standards are understood by all relevant stakeholders.


What You’ll Bring To The Role
  • Previous experience in managing an IT business stream, e.g. Applications or Project Management, IT Operations
  • Experience in working within or leading a Technological Governance capability
  • A thorough understanding of the Governance and Assurance processes and ability to identify and manage risks
  • Sound interpersonal, communication, negotiation and influencing skills
  • Highly developed conceptual, analytical skills and attention to detail
  • Continues to follow through to ensure outcomes are achieved
  • Supporter and enabler of innovative delivery programs
  • Demonstrates the values and behaviours that contribute to a constructive, high performance culture
  • Ensures transparency and maintains high degree of integrity.


What We Offer In Return
  • An attractive and competitive remuneration package
  • Flexible working arrangements, including Work Life Balance and leave options
  • A focus on wellbeing (health insurance, flu vaccinations, skin checks)
  • Access to an Employee Assistance Program
  • Salary Continuance and Life Insurance
  • Commuter Club-discounted Myki
  • A centrally located office in vibrant Footscray, just 10 minute drive, or two train stops, from Melbourne’s CBD.


We have an inclusive working environment with employees from a variety of backgrounds. We acknowledge that diversity at City West Water increases the effectiveness of teams and our capacity for innovation. We welcome applications from Indigenous people, workers of all ages, people with disabilities, people who identify as LGBTIQ and those from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.

If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of the application so we can assist you through the recruitment process.

For a position description or to find out more about careers at City West Water and the opportunities we offer, please visit our careers page. You can watch our careers video to find out why City West Water is a great place to work.

Although applications for this role close at 11.59pm on 8 October 2018, you are encouraged to apply earlier as shortlisting will commence during the application process.

Applicants must be eligible to work in Australia and have a satisfactory police check.

We exist for our customers and to benefit our community

  • Government Administration
  • Financial Services

Job description

Who we are


We’re Unispace, a global architecture, planning and design firm with integrated project delivery capabilities. We believe that everyone should work in an environment that inspires productivity, peak performance, and delivers wellbeing every day. We practise what we preach, and are proud of our collaborative culture which is built on talent and experience that spans the globe. We enable our team to provide diverse, fresh perspectives to our clients and be courageous in challenging the conventions of the way we work, live and learn.

We are looking for a well-rounded and organised Assistant Project Manager to support our Delivery team to deliver successful projects to our clients.


Who you are


  • You’re an adaptable and flexible Administrator, with a drive to learn new skills.
  • An excellent communicator, you have a can-do attitude and the ability to take direction.
  • ‘Team player’ is your middle name, and you are adept at building strong working relationships with your team and all stakeholders.
  • You’re a champion at time management and can prioritise tasks effectively.
  • You thrive under pressure and have a reputation for your strong attention to detail.


Your responsibilities


  • Managing the procurement process.
  • Handling large volumes of documents and requirements.
  • Building strong and cohesive relationship with site managers and suppliers.
  • Working closely with project managers to ensure all contracts are in line with agreements.
  • Negotiating and reviewing subcontractor agreements.
  • Building strong working relationships with builders and sub-contractors.
  • Ensuring all processes are streamlined and efficient.
  • Assisting in management and tracking of project expenditure against budget.
  • Preparing and managing variations.


What you’ll need

  • Good understanding of Australian standard contracts.
  • Relevant tertiary qualification and experience in the construction industry.
  • Knowledge of WHS standards and procedures, BCA and Australian Standards.
  • General knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word, Outlook and Adobe PDF Skills.


The successful candidate will have a pivotal role in an interesting project, receive an attractive salary, and have a great opportunity to grow and develop your career.

884747641:
[

Strategic Partnerships Manager

Company Name Xero Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 6 hours ago Number of views 33 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Xero


At Xero we are rewiring the small business economy and want millions of small businesses to thrive through beautiful software, advice and connections. We aim to make being a small business more efficient and profitable for small business owners, and more enjoyable too. \xa0 We’re making some great progress with over 1.4 million global subscribers currently on the platform. Xero was rated by Canstar Blue as Australia’s best accounting software three consecutive years from 2015-2017.

\xa0

About the role \xa0


We’re on the hunt for a proven Strategic Partnerships Manager to join our dynamic Platform Growth team; a team tasked with evolving the Xero platform through our app ecosystem, data innovation, strategic partner development and new product delivery to market. \xa0This role will manage key strategic relationships from partnership inception, through to execution and ongoing realisation of value for Xero customers and commercial return for Xero. Key metrics include revenue generation, customer retention, and customer acquisition.

\xa0

What you’ll do


  • Identify potential ‘Xero Connect' integration partners and build a pipeline of opportunities based on existing and new contacts.
  • Identify existing or potential technology partners with whom Xero can work with to provide value to small business customers and drive commercial outcomes for Xero.
  • Evaluate and prioritise opportunities from a strategic, financial and operational perspective
  • Work cross functionally to structure proposals including GTM plans, targets, requirements, fee models or incentive structures, legal and operational implications.
  • Work with developer evangelist team to oversee the development of platform partner integrations to ensure they are best in class and solve small business pain points.
  • Work cross functionally to launch new partnerships and integrations, creating excitement and driving uptake through comms, social and media efforts.
  • Ensure partners are fulfilling their contractual obligations and that Xero is providing the required support for them to do so
  • Work with the Strategic Partnerships team, Platform Growth Director \xa0& Ecosystem in formulating, implementing and managing strategic business plans across enterprise, government and other entities to ensure success. Success measured by growth in revenue, customer connections and new customer acquisition.
  • Coordinate stakeholders to ensure effective account management and tasks associated with realising outcomes and benefits of partnership account/s
  • Work closely with strategic partners and the sales enablement channel to determine their present and future needs and shape suitable channel initiatives in order to maintain and grow acquisition for Xero and the respective partner
  • Act as the main interface between the partner and the organisation to ensure strong partnership communications, an optimal level of service is provided, and participation in client's strategic business planning processes

What you’ll bring \xa0


  • Previous experience in a channel or strategic partnership development role with a focus on negotiating commercial agreements and influencing internal teams to deliver solutions
  • Proven sales & marketing abilities including outstanding negotiation skills, persuasive ability and relationship building skills.
  • The ability to motivate and manage direct and indirect teams of employees across multiple functions and deal with clients at all levels and translate client needs into a complete solution
  • The ability to manage both business as usual and project requirements in a fast paced and dynamic environment experiencing continued growth and expansion.
  • An innovative, team-orientated and results-focused approach
  • An understanding of SaaS/platform/ecosystem fundamentals will be highly regarded

\xa0

This is a fantastic opening that will play a key role in the evolution of our Platform Growth team in Australia.


At Xero, we are proud of our collaborative and inclusive culture that allows creativity to thrive and innovation to flourish. \xa0We promote flexible working arrangements and we foster an environment that enables our employees to do the best work of their lives.

If you’re ready for your next challenge with a purpose-led business then we’d like to hear from you.


Apply today.

[

Casual Language Educators

Company Name RMIT Training Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 6 hours ago Number of views 28 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

RMIT English Worldwide Melbourne are looking for Language Educators who are interested in casual teaching positions across our range of ELICOS (English Language Intensive Course for Overseas Students) EAP courses. Casual Language Educators are responsible for the delivery and associated administration of English language classes under the guidance of Team Leaders and the Deputy Director.


If you have a positive, proactive attitude and are passionate about delivering exceptional and exciting programs for students, then we would love to hear from you. Successful applicants must be avaialble to attend an induction session on Monday 8 October.\xa0\xa0


As a casual Language Educator you will be required to:

  • Prepare classes, including lesson planning
  • Present and supervise relevant classes, across the full range of REW's programs
  • Accurately complete centre administrative requirements in a timely fashion
  • Mark class work arising from classes taught
  • Conduct student consultations
  • Complete exam marking
  • Understand and comply with the pedagogical principles and methodologies underpinning REW curriculum
  • Contribute to the pastoral care and welfare of REW students and commit to enhancing their REW experience
  • Attend meetings and training sessions
  • Commit to the use of educational technology in the classroom
  • Source supplementary materials and ensure all materials are copyright compliant


To be successful in this role you must have:

  • ESL qualifications and experience to satisfy NEAS requirements (e.g. recognised Bachelor degree (or equivalent) plus a recognised TESOL qualification)
  • A current Working With Children Check
  • Flexibility with working hours
  • Excellent communication (both written and spoken English – at either native speaker or IELTS 8+ level) and interpersonal skills
  • Strong organisational and administration skills


Submit your application (including your resume and a one page cover letter outlining your suitability for the role) by clicking Apply Now. We are reviewing applications as we receive them and inviting candidates to attend interviews. Therefore, we encourage you to complete your application as soon as possible. Applications close Monday, 1 October at 9am.\xa0

\xa0

RMIT English Worldwide is a division of RMIT Training Pty Ltd – a wholly owned subsidiary of RMIT University. For more information, visit our website www.rmittraining.com


Our people are integral to the success of our Company. We are experienced professionals who are committed to providing the highest standard of service and support to our clients and colleagues. At RMIT Training we offer a friendly, supportive and flexible working environment and culture with a range of employee benefits including access to health and wellbeing services and discounts, discounted travel, professional development opportunities and more.
